Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the problem was the gatewaysdeposit used the wrong pubkey, it used the default pubkey and in your deposit the claimpubkey was different

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so do another gatewaydeposit

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: using same cointxid. it should fail. if not that is a bug, as we cant be letting people do multiple deposits with the same cointxid!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, even in the mempool it should fail

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is a very important error that we need to verify we are getting

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once that is verified, then you need to do another KMD deposit, but do it exactly the same and this time it should make a deposittxid that is spendable by the claimpubkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you did a convert to the redeem address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you need to convert to your own pubkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then the withdraw spends those 241 tokens for the withdraw

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as it is, you made a donation of those tokens

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I see :/ My own pubkey = any pubkey on which I want to withdraw funds?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes. whoever owns the tokens when the withdraw is done gets to say where they end up

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: So pubkeys in `tokenconvert` and `gatewayswithdraw` needs to be same

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you need to think in terms of the CC gateway

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its job is to convert tokens for KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the person that does the withdraw must own the tokens

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the destination pubkey on the KMD side can be any pubkey
